SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Localize the Last Refresh Timestamp on the Scaled Cart Page

The Scaled Cart page shows the date and time when the cart's prices were most recently refreshed. If your storefront supports multiple locales, you can localize the date and time format for a specific locale.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) only



USER PERMISSIONS
NEEDED
To create static resources:	Customize Application

The refresh timestamp on the Scaled Cart page references the value of the cart's Repriced Date field. The timestamp uses a localizable CC Page Label record with tokens that represent the date and time to show.

The default page label for the en_US locale uses the following format:

Last Refresh: {0} at {1}
TOKEN	VALUE
{0}	The date, formatted for the storefront's selected locale.
{1}	The time, formatted for the storefront's selected locale.

The date and time is formatted using JavaScript, which respects the browser's default date and time formats for different locales. To modify the default format for a specific locale, extend the CCRZ.uiProperties JavaScript object in your storefront's theme and add your customizations.

NOTE The default CCRZ.uiProperties object is defined in the default uiproperties.js file, which is installed with the CC_JavaScript_Framework static resource. The CCRZ.uiProperties object defines handlebars.js templates and partials for all components on the storefront, including the CartDetailView component.
Extend the default CCRZ.uiProperties object in your theme's uiproperties.js file. For more information, see CCRZ.uiProperties and Style Your Storefront with a Theme.
In your extension, add the localization property for the CartDetailView component.
CCRZ.uiProperties = $.extend(true, CCRZ.uiProperties, {
    CartDetailView: {
        localization: {
            // Add locales
        }
    }
}
Add one of your storefront's supported locales to the localization property, and define date and time options that are appropriate for the locale. For example, to customize the format for both the en-US and ja-JP locales, you can add the following properties:
NOTE In this example, the locale codes use a hyphen character to separate the language and region, as in en-US, because the web browser expects this format. When you select supported locales for your storefront and create internationalized records, you select locale codes that instead use an underscore character, as in en_US.
CCRZ.uiProperties = $.extend(true, CCRZ.uiProperties, {
    CartDetailView: {
        localization: {
            'en-US': {
                date: {
                    weekday: 'short',
                    month: 'short',
                    day: '2-digit',
                    year: 'numeric',
                    era: 'short'
                },
                time: {
                    hour12: true,
                    hour: 'numeric',
                    minute: '2-digit',
                    timeZoneName: 'short'
                }
            },
            'ja-JP': {
                 date: {
                     weekday: 'long',
                     month: 'short',
                     day: '2-digit',
                     year: 'numeric'
                 },
                 time: {
                     hour12: false,
                     hour: 'numeric',
                     minute: '2-digit',
                     timeZoneName: 'short'
                 }
            }
        }
    }
}

You can define the following date options:

day
'2-digit'
'numeric'
era
'long'
'narrow'
'short'
month
'2-digit'
'long'
'narrow'
'numeric'
'short'
weekday
'long'
'narrow'
'short'
year
'2-digit'
'numeric'

You can define the following time options:

hour
'2-digit'
'numeric'
hour12
true
false
minute
'2-digit'
'numeric'
second
'2-digit'
'numeric'
timeZoneName
'long'
'short'
NOTE For more information and examples about each option, see Mozilla Documentation: Intl.DateTimeFormat() constructor

title: Customizing Cart Refresh Timestamp for Multi-Locale Storefronts
